title: ICE when using Fn trait of GAT parameter in Fn return impl

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(generic_associated_types)] pub trait Scalar: 'static { type RefType<'a>: ScalarRef<'a>; } pub trait ScalarRef<'a>: 'a {} impl Scalar for i32 { type RefType<'a> = i32; } impl Scalar for String { type RefType<'a> = &'a str; } impl<'a> ScalarRef<'a> for i32 {} impl<'a> ScalarRef<'a> for &'a str {} fn cmp_eq<'a, 'b, A: Scalar, B: Scalar>(a: A::RefType<'a>, b: B::RefType<'b>) -> bool { todo!() } fn str_contains(a: &str, b: &str) -> bool { a.contains(b) } fn build_expression( ) -> impl Fn(A::RefType<'_>, B::RefType<'_>) -> O { cmp_eq:: } fn main() { println!("Hello, world!"); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0-nightly (8cdb3cd94 2022-01-25) binary: rustc commit-hash: 8cdb3cd94efece1e17cbd8f6edb1dc1a482779a0 commit-date: 2022-01-25 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.60.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/8cdb3cd94efece1e17cbd8f6edb1dc1a482779a0/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs:1036:9 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', /rustc/8cdb3cd94efece1e17cbd8f6edb1dc1a482779a0/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/sty.rs:1036:9 stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic 3: ::infer_projection 4: ::try_fold_with::::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#3}, ::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#4}, ::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#5}>> 5: <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_middle::ty::fold::TypeFoldable>::try_fold_with::::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#3}, ::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#4}, ::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#5}>> 6: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_middle::ty::fold::TypeFoldable>::super_fold_with::::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#3}, ::fold_opaque_ty::{closure#4}, Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0-nightly (8cdb3cd94 2022-01-25) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `build_expression` #1 [mir_built] building MIR for `build_expression` #2 [unsafety_check_result] unsafety-checking `build_expression` #3 [mir_const] processing MIR for `build_expression` #4 [mir_promoted] processing `build_expression` #5 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `build_expression` #6 [type_of] computing type of `build_expression::{opaque#0}` #7 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in top-level module #8 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `rust-bug` ```

Thanks for investigating into this issue!
